title: Ticket #881: Windows kbdd needs firewall exception
description: #714 adds the condor_kbdd to Windows to solve active session detection problems on Vista and later. However, the kbdd is being blocked by the Windows firewall. We need roughly the same holes punched in the firewall that other Condor daemons do. Either the installer should do it (okay) or the condor_master should do it like it does for other daemons (better). Without this change, a typical install on Windows won't successfully run the kbdd. Since we've shifted to exclusively using the kbdd, this is a regression even on pre-Vista machines.
remarks:
2009-Oct-22 14:36:00 by matt:
This should not be done via the installer.

2009-Oct-22 14:38:15 by ziliang:
We couldn't do it through the installer right now anyway. The makemsi version we're using doesn't have support for it.
